verses.kjv: If there arise among you a prophet, or a dreamer of dreams, and giveth thee a sign or a wonder,
verses.web: If a prophet or a dreamer of dreams arises among you, and he gives you a sign or a wonder,
verses.ct: If a prophet or someone who claims to have visions rises up among you and offers you a sign or a miracle,

verses.kjv: And the sign or the wonder come to pass, whereof he spake unto thee, saying, Let us go after other gods, which thou hast not known, and let us serve them;
verses.web: and the sign or the wonder comes to pass, of which he spoke to you, saying, “Let’s go after other gods” (which you have not known) “and let’s serve them,”
verses.ct: and that sign or miracle actually happens — but then he says, "Come, let's follow other gods you've never known and worship them" —

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not hearken unto the words of that prophet, or that dreamer of dreams: for the LORD your God proveth you, to know whether ye love the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul.
verses.web: you shall not listen to the words of that prophet, or to that dreamer of dreams; for LORD your God is testing you, to know whether you love LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul.
verses.ct: don't listen to that prophet or dreamer. The LORD your God is testing you to find out whether you truly love the LORD your God with all your heart and all your soul.

verses.kjv: Ye shall walk after the LORD your God, and fear him, and keep his commandments, and obey his voice, and ye shall serve him, and cleave unto him.
verses.web: You shall walk after LORD your God, fear him, keep his commandments, and obey his voice. You shall serve him, and cling to him.
verses.ct: Follow the LORD your God alone. Fear him, keep his commandments, obey his voice, serve him, and hold tightly to him.

verses.kjv: And that prophet, or that dreamer of dreams, shall be put to death; because he hath spoken to turn you away from the LORD your God, which brought you out of the land of Egypt, and redeemed you out of the house of bondage, to thrust thee out of the way which the LORD thy God commanded thee to walk in. So shalt thou put the evil away from the midst of thee.
verses.web: That prophet, or that dreamer of dreams, shall be put to death, because he has spoken rebellion against LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt and redeemed you out of the house of bondage, to draw you aside out of the way which LORD your God commanded you to walk in. So you shall remove the evil from among you.
verses.ct: That prophet or dreamer must be put to death, because he tried to turn you away from the LORD your God — the one who brought you out of Egypt and rescued you from slavery. He was trying to drag you off the path the LORD your God commanded you to walk. You must purge this evil from among you.

verses.kjv: If thy brother, the son of thy mother, or thy son, or thy daughter, or the wife of thy bosom, or thy friend, which is as thine own soul, entice thee secretly, saying, Let us go and serve other gods, which thou hast not known, thou, nor thy fathers;
verses.web: If your brother, the son of your mother, or your son, or your daughter, or the wife of your bosom, or your friend who is as your own soul, entices you secretly, saying, “Let’s go and serve other gods”—which you have not known, you, nor your fathers;
verses.ct: If someone close to you — your own brother, your son, your daughter, the wife you love, or a friend as dear to you as your own soul — secretly tries to persuade you, saying, "Let's go worship other gods" — gods that neither you nor your ancestors have ever known —

verses.kjv: Namely, of the gods of the people which are round about you, nigh unto thee, or far off from thee, from the one end of the earth even unto the other end of the earth;
verses.web: of the gods of the peoples who are around you, near to you, or far off from you, from the one end of the earth even to the other end of the earth—
verses.ct: gods of the surrounding nations, whether nearby or far away, from one end of the earth to the other —

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not consent unto him, nor hearken unto him; neither shall thine eye pity him, neither shalt thou spare, neither shalt thou conceal him:
verses.web: you shall not consent to him nor listen to him; neither shall your eye pity him, neither shall you spare, neither shall you conceal him;
verses.ct: don't give in to him. Don't listen to him. Don't feel sorry for him, don't spare him, and don't cover for him.

verses.kjv: But thou shalt surely kill him; thine hand shall be first upon him to put him to death, and afterwards the hand of all the people.
verses.web: but you shall surely kill him. Your hand shall be first on him to put him to death, and afterwards the hands of all the people.
verses.ct: You must put him to death. Your own hand must strike first, and then the rest of the people will follow.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt stone him with stones, that he die; because he hath sought to thrust thee away from the LORD thy God, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage.
verses.web: You shall stone him to death with stones, because he has sought to draw you away from LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
verses.ct: Stone him to death, because he tried to pull you away from the LORD your God, who brought you out of Egypt, out of slavery.

verses.kjv: And all Israel shall hear, and fear, and shall do no more any such wickedness as this is among you.
verses.web: All Israel shall hear, and fear, and shall not do any more wickedness like this among you.
verses.ct: Then all Israel will hear about it and be afraid, and no one among you will ever do something this wicked again.

verses.kjv: If thou shalt hear say in one of thy cities, which the LORD thy God hath given thee to dwell there, saying,
verses.web: If you hear about one of your cities, which LORD your God gives you to dwell there, that
verses.ct: If you hear a report about one of the cities the LORD your God has given you to live in —

verses.kjv: Certain men, the children of Belial, are gone out from among you, and have withdrawn the inhabitants of their city, saying, Let us go and serve other gods, which ye have not known;
verses.web: certain wicked fellows have gone out from among you and have drawn away the inhabitants of their city, saying, “Let’s go and serve other gods,” which you have not known,
verses.ct: that certain worthless troublemakers from among you have led the people of their city astray, saying, "Let's go worship other gods" — gods you've never known —

verses.kjv: Then shalt thou enquire, and make search, and ask diligently; and, behold, if it be truth, and the thing certain, that such abomination is wrought among you;
verses.web: then you shall inquire, investigate, and ask diligently. Behold, if it is true, and the thing certain, that such abomination was done among you,
verses.ct: then you must investigate thoroughly. Question people carefully. If it turns out to be true — if this disgusting thing really happened among you —

verses.kjv: Thou shalt surely smite the inhabitants of that city with the edge of the sword, destroying it utterly, and all that is therein, and the cattle thereof, with the edge of the sword.
verses.web: you shall surely strike the inhabitants of that city with the edge of the sword, destroying it utterly, with all that is therein and its livestock, with the edge of the sword.
verses.ct: you must put every person in that city to the sword. Destroy the entire city completely — everyone in it and even the livestock.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt gather all the spoil of it into the midst of the street thereof, and shalt burn with fire the city, and all the spoil thereof every whit, for the LORD thy God: and it shall be an heap for ever; it shall not be built again.
verses.web: You shall gather all its plunder into the middle of its street, and shall burn with fire the city, with all of its plunder, to LORD your God. It shall be a heap forever. It shall not be built again.
verses.ct: Pile all the plunder in the middle of the city square and burn the whole city and everything in it as an offering to the LORD your God. It must remain a permanent ruin, never to be rebuilt.

verses.kjv: And there shall cleave nought of the cursed thing to thine hand: that the LORD may turn from the fierceness of his anger, and shew thee mercy, and have compassion upon thee, and multiply thee, as he hath sworn unto thy fathers;
verses.web: Nothing of the devoted thing shall cling to your hand, that LORD may turn from the fierceness of his anger and show you mercy, and have compassion on you and multiply you, as he has sworn to your fathers,
verses.ct: Don't keep any of the things set apart for destruction. Then the LORD will turn from his fierce anger and show you mercy. He will have compassion on you and increase your numbers, just as he promised your ancestors —

verses.kjv: When thou shalt hearken to the voice of the LORD thy God, to keep all his commandments which I command thee this day, to do that which is right in the eyes of the LORD thy God.
verses.web: when you listen to LORD your God’s voice, to keep all his commandments which I command you today, to do that which is right in LORD your God’s eyes.
verses.ct: as long as you listen to the LORD your God, keeping all his commandments that I'm giving you today, and doing what the LORD your God considers right.
